title: fitDTVARMxID: Fit the Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model
text: Fit discrete-time vector autoregressive model using OpenMx package.

title: fitDTVARMxID: Fit the Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model
text: can install released version fitDTVARMxID GitHub :

title: fitDTVARMxID: Fit the Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model
text: See GitHub Pages package documentation.

what: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
title: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
text: function fits first-order discrete-time vector autoregressive model unit ID.

title: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
code: FitDTVARMxID(   data,   observed,   id,   alpha_fixed = TRUE,   alpha_free = NULL,   alpha_values = NULL,   alpha_lbound = NULL,   alpha_ubound = NULL,   beta_fixed = FALSE,   beta_free = NULL,   beta_values = NULL,   beta_lbound = NULL,   beta_ubound = NULL,   psi_diag = FALSE,   psi_d_free = NULL,   psi_d_values = NULL,   psi_d_lbound = NULL,   psi_d_ubound = NULL,   psi_l_free = NULL,   psi_l_values = NULL,   psi_l_lbound = NULL,   psi_l_ubound = NULL,   nu_fixed = FALSE,   nu_free = NULL,   nu_values = NULL,   nu_lbound = NULL,   nu_ubound = NULL,   theta_diag = TRUE,   theta_fixed = FALSE,   theta_d_free = NULL,   theta_d_values = NULL,   theta_d_lbound = NULL,   theta_d_ubound = NULL,   theta_d_equal = FALSE,   theta_l_free = NULL,   theta_l_values = NULL,   theta_l_lbound = NULL,   theta_l_ubound = NULL,   mu0_fixed = TRUE,   mu0_func = FALSE,   mu0_free = NULL,   mu0_values = NULL,   mu0_lbound = NULL,   mu0_ubound = NULL,   sigma0_fixed = TRUE,   sigma0_func = FALSE,   sigma0_diag = FALSE,   sigma0_d_free = NULL,   sigma0_d_values = NULL,   sigma0_d_lbound = NULL,   sigma0_d_ubound = NULL,   sigma0_l_free = NULL,   sigma0_l_values = NULL,   sigma0_l_lbound = NULL,   sigma0_l_ubound = NULL,   tries_explore = 100,   tries_local = 10,   max_attempts = 10,   grad_tol = 0.01,   hess_tol = 1e-08,   eps = 1e-06,   factor = 10,   overwrite = FALSE,   path = getwd(),   prefix = "FitDTVARMxID",   seed = 42,   silent = FALSE,   ncores = NULL,   clean = TRUE )

title: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
text: data Data frame. data frame object data potentially multiple subjects contain column subject ID numbers (.e., ID variable), least one column observed values. observed Character vector. vector character strings names observed variables data. id Character string. character string name ID variable data. alpha_fixed Logical. TRUE, dynamic model intercept vector alpha fixed. FALSE, alpha estimated. alpha_free Logical vector indicating elements alpha freely estimated. NULL, elements free. Ignored alpha_fixed = TRUE. alpha_values Numeric vector values alpha. alpha_fixed = TRUE, fixed values. alpha_fixed = FALSE, starting values. NULL, defaults vector zeros. alpha_lbound Numeric vector lower bounds alpha. NULL, lower bounds set. Ignored alpha_fixed = TRUE. alpha_ubound Numeric vector upper bounds alpha. NULL, upper bounds set. Ignored alpha_fixed = TRUE. beta_fixed Logical. TRUE, dynamic model coefficient matrix beta fixed. FALSE, beta estimated. beta_free Logical matrix indicating elements beta freely estimated. NULL, elements free. Ignored beta_fixed = TRUE. beta_values Numeric matrix values beta. beta_fixed = TRUE, fixed values. beta_fixed = FALSE, starting values. NULL, defaults zero matrix. beta_lbound Numeric matrix lower bounds beta. NULL, defaults -1.5. Ignored beta_fixed = TRUE. beta_ubound Numeric matrix upper bounds beta. NULL, defaults +1.5. Ignored beta_fixed = TRUE. psi_diag Logical. TRUE, psi diagonal. FALSE, psi symmetric. psi_d_free Logical vector indicating free/fixed status elements psi_d. NULL, element psi_d free. psi_d_values Numeric vector starting values psi_d. NULL, defaults vector ones. psi_d_lbound Numeric vector lower bounds psi_d. NULL, lower bounds set. psi_d_ubound Numeric vector upper bounds psi_d. NULL, upper bounds set. psi_l_free Logical matrix indicating strictly-lower-triangular elements psi_l free. Ignored psi_diag = TRUE. psi_l_values Numeric matrix starting values strictly-lower-triangular elements psi_l. NULL, defaults null matrix. psi_l_lbound Numeric matrix lower bounds psi_l. NULL, lower bounds set. psi_l_ubound Numeric matrix upper bounds psi_l. NULL, upper bounds set. nu_fixed Logical. TRUE, measurement model intercept vector nu fixed. FALSE, nu estimated. nu_free Logical vector indicating elements nu freely estimated. NULL, elements free. Ignored nu_fixed = TRUE. nu_values Numeric vector values nu. nu_fixed = TRUE, fixed values. nu_fixed = FALSE, starting values. NULL, defaults vector zeros. nu_lbound Numeric vector lower bounds nu. NULL, lower bounds set. Ignored nu_fixed = TRUE. nu_ubound Numeric vector upper bounds nu. NULL, upper bounds set. Ignored nu_fixed = TRUE. theta_diag Logical. TRUE, theta diagonal. FALSE, theta symmetric. theta_fixed Logical. TRUE, measurement error matrix theta fixed SoftPlus(theta_d_values). FALSE, diagonal elements estimated (-diagonals fixed zero). theta_d_free Logical vector indicating free/fixed status diagonal parameters theta_d. NULL, element theta_d free. theta_d_values Numeric vector starting values theta_d. theta_fixed = TRUE, fixed values. theta_fixed = FALSE, starting values. NULL, defaults identity matrix. theta_d_lbound Numeric vector lower bounds theta_d. NULL, lower bounds set. theta_d_ubound Numeric vector upper bounds theta_d. NULL, upper bounds set. theta_d_equal Logical. TRUE, free diagonal elements theta_d constrained equal estimated single shared parameter (theta_eq). Ignored diagonal elements free. theta_l_free Logical matrix indicating strictly-lower-triangular elements theta_l free. Ignored theta_diag = TRUE. theta_l_values Numeric matrix starting values strictly-lower-triangular elements theta_l. NULL, defaults null matrix. theta_l_lbound Numeric matrix lower bounds theta_l. NULL, lower bounds set. theta_l_ubound Numeric matrix upper bounds theta_l. NULL, upper bounds set. mu0_fixed Logical. TRUE, initial mean vector mu0 fixed. FALSE, mu0 estimated. mu0_func Logical. TRUE mu0_fixed = TRUE, mu0 fixed \( (- \beta)^{-1} \alpha \). mu0_free Logical vector indicating elements mu0 freely estimated. mu0_values Numeric vector values mu0. mu0_fixed = TRUE, fixed values. mu0_fixed = FALSE, starting values. NULL, defaults vector zeros. mu0_lbound Numeric vector lower bounds mu0. NULL, lower bounds set. Ignored mu0_fixed = TRUE. mu0_ubound Numeric vector upper bounds mu0. NULL, upper bounds set. Ignored mu0_fixed = TRUE. sigma0_fixed Logical. TRUE, initial covariance matrix sigma0 fixed. FALSE, sigma0 estimated. sigma0_func Logical. TRUE sigma0_fixed = TRUE, sigma0 fixed \( (- \beta \otimes \beta)^{-1} \mathrm{Vec}(\Psi) \). sigma0_diag Logical. TRUE, sigma0 diagonal. FALSE, sigma0 symmetric. sigma0_d_free Logical vector indicating free/fixed status elements sigma0_d. NULL, element sigma0_d free. sigma0_d_values Numeric vector starting values sigma0_d. NULL, defaults vector ones. sigma0_d_lbound Numeric vector lower bounds sigma0_d. NULL, lower bounds set. sigma0_d_ubound Numeric vector upper bounds sigma0_d. NULL, upper bounds set. sigma0_l_free Logical matrix indicating strictly-lower-triangular elements sigma0_l free. Ignored sigma0_diag = TRUE. sigma0_l_values Numeric matrix starting values strictly-lower-triangular elements sigma0_l. NULL, defaults null matrix. sigma0_l_lbound Numeric matrix lower bounds sigma0_l. NULL, lower bounds set. sigma0_l_ubound Numeric matrix upper bounds sigma0_l. NULL, upper bounds set. tries_explore Integer. Number extra tries wide exploration phase using OpenMx::mxTryHardWideSearch() checkHess = FALSE. tries_local Integer. Number extra tries local polishing via OpenMx::mxTryHard() gradients remain tolerance. max_attempts Integer. Maximum number remediation attempts first Hessian computation fails criteria. attempt may nudge bounds, refit locally without Hessian, , last attempt, relax bounds. grad_tol Numeric. Tolerance maximum absolute gradient. Smaller values stricter. hess_tol Numeric. Minimum allowable Hessian eigenvalue. Smaller values less strict. eps Numeric. Proximity threshold detect parameters bounds nudge inward 10 * eps. factor Numeric. Multiplicative factor relax parameter bounds final remediation attempt. Lower bounds divided factor upper bounds multiplied factor. overwrite Logical. TRUE, existing intermediate files overwritten. Defaults FALSE. path Character string. Directory save intermediate files. prefix Alphanumeric character string. Prefix use naming intermediate files. seed Random seed reproducibility. silent Logical. TRUE, suppresses messages model fitting stage. ncores Positive integer. Number cores use. clean Logical. TRUE, clean intermediate files saved path.

title: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
text: Returns object class dtvarmxid list following elements: call Function call. args List function arguments. fun Function used ("FitDTVARMxID"). output list fitted OpenMx models.

title: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
text: measurement model given $$   \mathbf{y}_{, t}   =   \boldsymbol{\nu}   +   \boldsymbol{\Lambda}   \boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t}   +   \boldsymbol{\varepsilon}_{, t},   \quad   \mathrm{}   \quad   \boldsymbol{\varepsilon}_{, t}   \sim   \mathcal{N}   \left(   \mathbf{0},   \boldsymbol{\Theta}   \right) $$ \(\mathbf{y}_{, t}\), \(\boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t}\), \(\boldsymbol{\varepsilon}_{, t}\) random variables \(\boldsymbol{\nu}\), \(\boldsymbol{\Lambda}\), \(\boldsymbol{\Theta}\) model parameters. \(\mathbf{y}_{, t}\) represents vector observed random variables, \(\boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t}\) vector latent random variables, \(\boldsymbol{\varepsilon}_{, t}\) vector random measurement errors, time \(t\) individual \(\). \(\boldsymbol{\Lambda}\) denotes matrix factor loadings, \(\boldsymbol{\Theta}\) covariance matrix \(\boldsymbol{\varepsilon}\). model, \(\boldsymbol{\Lambda}\) identity matrix \(\boldsymbol{\Theta}\) diagonal matrix. dynamic structure given $$   \boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t}   =   \boldsymbol{\alpha}   +   \boldsymbol{\beta}   \boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t - 1}   +   \boldsymbol{\zeta}_{, t},   \quad   \mathrm{}   \quad   \boldsymbol{\zeta}_{, t}   \sim   \mathcal{N}   \left(   \mathbf{0},   \boldsymbol{\Psi}   \right) $$ \(\boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t}\), \(\boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t - 1}\), \(\boldsymbol{\zeta}_{, t}\) random variables, \(\boldsymbol{\alpha}\), \(\boldsymbol{\beta}\), \(\boldsymbol{\Psi}\) model parameters. , \(\boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t}\) vector latent variables time \(t\) individual \(\), \(\boldsymbol{\eta}_{, t - 1}\) represents vector latent variables time \(t - 1\) individual \(\), \(\boldsymbol{\zeta}_{, t}\) represents vector dynamic noise time \(t\) individual \(\). \(\boldsymbol{\alpha}\) denotes vector intercepts, \(\boldsymbol{\beta}\) matrix autoregression cross regression coefficients, \(\boldsymbol{\Psi}\) covariance matrix \(\boldsymbol{\zeta}_{, t}\).

title: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
text: Hunter, M. D. (2017). State space modeling open source, modular, structural equation modeling environment. Structural Equation Modeling: Multidisciplinary Journal, 25(2), 307–324. doi:10.1080/10705511.2017.1369354 Neale, M. C., Hunter, M. D., Pritikin, J. N., Zahery, M., Brick, T. R., Kirkpatrick, R. M., Estabrook, R., Bates, T. C., Maes, H. H., & Boker, S. M. (2015). OpenMx 2.0: Extended structural equation statistical modeling. Psychometrika, 81(2), 535–549. doi:10.1007/s11336-014-9435-8

title: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

title: Fit the First-Order Discrete-Time Vector Autoregressive Model by ID — FitDTVARMxID
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Generate data using the simStateSpace package------------------------------ set.seed(42) k <- 2 n <- 5 time <- 100 alpha <- rep(x = 0, times = k) beta <- matrix(   data = c(.5, .0, .2, .5),   nrow = k,   ncol = k ) psi <- matrix(   data = c(exp(-4.1), exp(-3.9), exp(-3.9), exp(-3.2)),   nrow = k,   ncol = k ) psi_l <- t(chol(psi)) nu <- rep(x = 5, times = k) lambda <- diag(k) theta <- matrix(   data = c(exp(-2), 0, 0, exp(-2.8)),   nrow = k,   ncol = k ) theta_l <- t(chol(theta)) mu0 <- c(solve(diag(k) - beta) %*% alpha) sigma0 <- matrix(   data = c(     solve(diag(k * k) - beta %x% beta) %*% c(psi)   ),   nrow = k,   ncol = k ) sigma0_l <- t(chol(sigma0)) sim <- simStateSpace::SimSSMIVary(   n = n,   time,   mu0 = list(mu0),   sigma0_l = list(sigma0_l),   alpha = list(alpha),   beta = simStateSpace::SimBetaN(     n = n,     beta = beta,     vcov_beta_vec_l = t(chol(0.1 * diag(k * k)))   ),   psi_l = list(psi_l),   nu = list(nu),   lambda = list(lambda),   theta_l = list(theta_l) ) data <- as.data.frame(sim)  # Fit the model-------------------------------------------------------------- library(fitDTVARMxID) fit <- FitDTVARMxID(   data = data,   observed = paste0("y", seq_len(k)),   id = "id" ) print(fit) summary(fit) coef(fit) vcov(fit) converged(fit) } # }

what: LDL' Decomposition of a Symmetric Positive-Definite Matrix — LDL
title: LDL' Decomposition of a Symmetric Positive-Definite Matrix — LDL
text: Performs LDL' factorization symmetric positive-definite matrix \(X\), $$X = L D L^\top,$$ \(L\) unit lower-triangular (ones diagonal) \(D\) diagonal.

title: LDL' Decomposition of a Symmetric Positive-Definite Matrix — LDL
LDL' Decomposition of a Symmetric Positive-Definite Matrix — LDL
text: x Numeric matrix. Must symmetric positive-definite.

title: LDL' Decomposition of a Symmetric Positive-Definite Matrix — LDL
text: list components: l_mat_unit Unit lower-triangular matrix \(L\). l_mat_strict Strictly lower-triangular part \(L\). d_mat Diagonal matrix \(D\). d_vec Vector diagonal entries \(D\). d_uc Unconstrained vector \(\mathrm{softplus}(d\_uc) = d\_vec\). x Original input matrix. y Reconstructed matrix \(L D L^\top\). diff Difference x - y.

title: LDL' Decomposition of a Symmetric Positive-Definite Matrix — LDL
text: function returns unit lower-triangular factor \(L\) diagonal factor \(D\). strictly lower-triangular part \(L\) also provided convenience. function additionally computes unconstrained vector d_uc softplus(d_uc) = d_vec, using \(\mathrm{softplus}^{-1}(y) = \log(\exp(y) - 1)\) stable back-transformation.

title: LDL' Decomposition of a Symmetric Positive-Definite Matrix — LDL
code: set.seed(123) A <- matrix(rnorm(16), 4, 4) S <- crossprod(A) + diag(1e-6, 4) # SPD out <- LDL(S) max(abs(out$diff)) #> [1] 4.440892e-16

what: Softplus and Inverse Softplus Transformations — Softplus
title: Softplus and Inverse Softplus Transformations — Softplus
text: softplus transformation maps unconstrained real values positive real line. useful parameters (e.g., variances) must strictly positive. inverse softplus transformation recovers unconstrained value positive input.

title: Softplus and Inverse Softplus Transformations — Softplus
Softplus and Inverse Softplus Transformations — Softplus
text: x Numeric vector matrix. Input values transformed.

title: Softplus and Inverse Softplus Transformations — Softplus
text: Softplus(): numeric vector matrix strictly positive values. InvSoftplus(): numeric vector matrix unconstrained values.

title: Softplus and Inverse Softplus Transformations — Softplus
text: Softplus(x) = log(1 + exp(x)) InvSoftplus(x) = log(exp(x) - 1) numerical stability, functions use log1p() expm1() internally.

title: Softplus and Inverse Softplus Transformations — Softplus
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

title: Softplus and Inverse Softplus Transformations — Softplus
code: # Apply softplus to unconstrained values x <- c(-5, 0, 5) y <- Softplus(x)  # Recover unconstrained values x_recovered <- InvSoftplus(y)  y #> [1] 0.006715348 0.693147181 5.006715348 x_recovered #> [1] -5  0  5

title: Check Model Convergence — converged
text: Evaluate whether OpenMx fit converged successfully.

title: Check Model Convergence — converged
code: converged(object, ...)  # S3 method for class 'dtvarmxid' converged(   object,   grad_tol = 0.01,   hess_tol = 1e-08,   vanishing_theta = TRUE,   theta_tol = 0.001,   prop = FALSE,   ... )

title: Check Model Convergence — converged
text: object object class dtvarmxid. ... Passed /used methods. grad_tol Numeric scalar. Tolerance maximum absolute gradient. hess_tol Numeric scalar. Tolerance Hessian eigenvalues; eigenvalues must strictly greater value. vanishing_theta Logical. Test measurement error variance going zero. theta_tol Numeric. Tolerance vanishing theta test. prop Logical. prop = FALSE, named logical vector indicating, individual fit, whether convergence criteria met. prop = TRUE, proportion cases converged.

title: Check Model Convergence — converged
text: dtvarmxid method: prop = FALSE, named logical vector indicating, individual fit, whether convergence criteria met. prop = TRUE, proportion cases converged.

title: Check Model Convergence — converged
text: Convergence defined three criteria: Status code equals 0L. maximum absolute gradient grad_tol. Hessian positive definite eigenvalues greater hess_tol. vanishing_theta = TRUE, model additionally checks diagonal elements measurement error covariance matrix (\(\Theta\)) vanishingly small, “small” defined theta_tol.

title: Check Model Convergence — converged
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan
